intro: Tephrosia zambiana, commonly known as Zambian tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and slightly hairy. The flowers are small and clustered in racemes, often displaying shades of white or pale purple.
